alert.note: Alert for Dearborn; Franklin; Ripley (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 23 at 6:57PM EDT until July 23 at 7:45PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wilmington has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Franklin County in southeastern Indiana... Northeastern Ripley County in southeastern Indiana... Northwestern Dearborn County in southeastern Indiana... * Until 745 PM EDT. * At 657 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Batesville, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Batesville, Milan, Oldenburg, Moores Hill, Manchester, Sunman, Huntersville, Hamburg, Ballstown, Penntown, Weisburg, Interstate 74 at State Route 101, Lawrenceville, Saint Peter and New Alsace. This includes I-74 in Indiana between mile markers 145 and 160. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
